conclusion: Analyze the process on the PV diagram and use the given information.
The process from D to A is a horizontal line on the PV diagram, indicating an isobaric process at pressure P1.
The work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
Here, P = P1 and ΔV = V1 - V2.
Substitute the values into the work formula: W = P1 (V1 - V2).
Since V1 < V2, V1 - V2 is negative.
The work done by the gas is negative, indicating that work is done on the gas rather than by the gas.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is W = P1 (V1 - V2), which is negative.
